title: 114_s529
content:
The Act is titled the "Combating Human Trafficking Act of 2015" and includes provisions for enhancing services for runaway and homeless victims of youth trafficking. It also amends the Runaway and Homeless Youth Act. The Runaway and Homeless Youth Act is amended to include provisions related to severe forms of trafficking in persons and sex trafficking. The Runaway and Homeless Youth Act is amended to include provisions related to severe forms of trafficking in persons and sex trafficking, defining terms and expanding protections for youth victims. TITLE II--IMPROVING THE RESPONSE TO VICTIMS OF CHILD SEX TRAFFICKING

Amendment to the Missing Children's Assistance Act expands the definition to include child sex trafficking. 

TITLE III--INTERAGENCY TASK FORCE TO MONITOR AND COMBAT TRAFFICKING

The "Human Trafficking Prevention, Intervention, and Recovery Act of 2015" establishes an interagency task force to combat trafficking and defines a victim of trafficking. The Interagency Task Force to Monitor and Combat Trafficking, established under the Trafficking Victims Protection Act of 2000, conducts a review on trafficking in persons in the United States, including activities to deter trafficking offenses and prevent children from becoming victims. The Interagency Task Force to Monitor and Combat Trafficking, established under the Trafficking Victims Protection Act of 2000, reviews trafficking in persons in the United States. It focuses on preventing children from becoming victims of trafficking, commercial sexual exploitation, and other related topics. The Task Force identifies best practices to deter trafficking offenses and prevent child victimization, as well as gaps in research for formulating effective strategies. The Interagency Task Force to Monitor and Combat Trafficking will provide a report to Congress and the public within 1 year of the enactment of this Act, detailing the review conducted on trafficking. SEC. 304 requires the Comptroller General to report on law enforcement efforts against human trafficking and Federal grant programs for combating trafficking. SEC. 305 allows housing programs for trafficking victims under the Trafficking Victims Protection Act of 2000.
